item.title: Dashboard App Front End: Ionic React
item.description: David Seo, a rising junior at Vanderbilt University studying Computer Science and Applied Mathematics, shares his journey with constructing smooth and easy-to-use User Interface for the Dashboard App using Ionic React.

item.title: Apple Watch
item.description: Apple Watch is a line of smartwatches produced by Apple Inc. It incorporates fitness tracking and health-oriented capabilities with integration with iOS and other Apple products and services.

item.title: Dashboard App Back End: MongoDB and GraphQL
item.description: Aadi Bajpai, a rising sophomore at Vanderbilt University studying Computer Science, shares his journey with constructing firm and fluid backend.

item.title: License Detection App: OpenALPR and React Native
item.description: David Seo, a rising junior at Vanderbilt University studying Computer Science and Applied Mathematics, shares his journey with constructing easy-to-use license detection app using React Native.

item.title: Professor Brad Malin
item.description: Professor Brad Malin provides expert guidance on the privacy aspects of the project, such as how to define and ensure privacy.

item.title: Professor Chris Slobogin
item.description: Professor Chris Slobogin provides expert guidance on the legal aspects of the project, such as 4th amendment jurisprudence and precedents.

item.title: Professor Ken Pence
item.description: Professor Ken Pence provides expert guidance on the law enforcement aspects of the project, such as building and fostering trust between communities and law enforcement.

item.title: Team Work
item.description: Professor Daniel A. Balasubramanian, Aadi Bajpai, and David Seo share their experience with collaborating with each other both remotely and in-person.

item.title: Professor Daniel A. Balasubramanian
item.description: Professor Daniel A. Balasubramanian provides expert guidance on the technological aspects of the project, leading the intern team in creating the application.
